Module hu.unipannon.virt.plot

Package hu.unipannon.virt.plot.frame

The frame package is the core of the library's graphical system. It contains all the displayable components and basic functions that can turn them on/off. The controllers can later use these functions to automate the process of activating and deactivating plot components such as certain axes or tick marks.

We call the complete graphical representation of a general plot a Frame. The Frame contains every component of the plot i.e. Axes, Tick Marks, Labels. These are the components that can be found in every type of plots (Line, Bar, etc.). The Plot Type specific graphical items, such as lines or boxes are in a separate container, the Plot Space. The Plot Space can be inserted into any kind of Frame, and can contain any kind of plot elements. This makes combined line and bar plots possible.

To make plots fully customizable, the Frame generates all possible axis elements at all positions. Those elements can be turned on and off individually with the specific component's methods. Components that belong to specific axes are grouped together and managed with their own methods. The Frame class contains these groups, that can be turned on and queried for their specific operations. (Important: turning on an Axis does not turn on any lines or ticks, they need to be turned on separately with the Axis object).
Example:

   frame.showVerticalAxis();
   frame.getVerticalAxis().showLeftLine();


The Graphics System works with properties. Component positions and offsets can be expressed with relations to other componenst properties (position, width, height). The basis of the coordinate system are the bottom left corner and the width and height parameters of components. This correlates with MATLAB's positioning system.
Author:
Tóth Bálint
  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Component
    Common interface for components featured in the Frame.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Container
    Abstract base class that is used to persist the same properties in the Frame.
    Frame
    Highest level Container class of the graphical system.
    Label
    Custom Label implementation that can rotate the label and align it to a specific VPos and HPos.
    Legend
    Legends can be displayed inside the Plot space.
    Marker
    Represents a marker item that can be positioned on the Plot Space.
    PlotSpace
    The Plot Space is the section in the frame surrounded by the axes.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    BarStyle
    Implemented styles of Bar plots.
    Marker.MarkerType
    All the possible types of markers currently implemented.
    StrokeStyle
    Implemented stroke types of Line Plots.
